message.content: We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The patient’s symptoms, including excessive facial hair growth and enlarged gums, are consistent with the side effects of phenytoin. None of the other options have reported these side effects.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The patient’s symptoms suggest hypertrichosis and gum hyperplasia, both of which are common side effects of Phenytoin. Beclomethasone and Albuterol are not known to cause these symptoms, while Garlic supplements are not typically associated with any notable side effects.
We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. Among the options, only phenytoin is known to cause hirsutism (excessive hair growth) and gingival hyperplasia (enlarged gums) as side effects.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The most likely diagnosis for the patient’s symptoms is Hirsutism, which can be caused by phenytoin. Beclomethasone and albuterol are unlikely to cause hirsutism. Garlic supplement is also unlikely to be the cause of this patient’s symptoms.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The presence of excessive facial hair growth and enlarged gums suggests the possibility of phenytoin-induced hypertrichosis and gingival hyperplasia. Other listed medications are not known to cause these symptoms.

The symptoms of excessive facial hair growth and enlarged gums suggest the diagnosis of hirsutism and gingival hyperplasia, which are known side effects of phenytoin. None of the other medications or supplements the patient is taking are associated with these symptoms.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. Phenytoin is an antiepileptic drug that can cause hirsutism, which is excessive hair growth, as an adverse effect. None of the other options are known to cause hirsutism. Enlarged gums is also a known adverse effect of phenytoin.
